# imagePosition

**Instance Property**

The position of the button’s image relative to its title.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var imagePosition: NSControl.ImagePosition { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is one of the image positions described in the “Constants” section of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCell]. If the title is above, below, or overlapping the image, or if there is no image, the text is horizontally centered within the button.

## Related Documentation

- **image**: The image displayed by the cell, if any.
- **NSButtonCell**: An object that defines the user interface of a button or other clickable region of a view.
- **setButtonType(_:)**: Sets how the button highlights while pressed and how it shows its state.

## Managing Images

- **alternateImage**: The image the button displays in its alternate state.
- **imageScaling**: The scale factor for the button’s image.
